author: FIFAfutChamp
text:
An investigation tends to happen in private and without publication to the wider organisation so as to encourage continued reporting and prevent an uneven power dynamic.

The meeting in question does address the allegations, reminds people of their obligations and encourages reporting, either via usual channels or anonymously.

Neither you, nor I are in a position to say whether these allegations were investigated at the time or even the quality of that investigation.

What we can conclude from the Terren statement, the recording and other evidence is the company was aware, they reminded people of their obligations and are now investigating via a third party, with a commitment to make the outcomes open and transparent.

What I do not anticipate is that the outcome will address these specific allegations or mention any particular employees, this is for the aforementioned reasons of privacy. What it will show however are any systemic failings, any actions which need to be taken, systems put in place to prevent further such issues and any disciplinary action which may take place as a result of the allegations being proven.

I refer to your original statement of "I'm no CEO or HR Manager". You have no idea of the correct process, and have been very unclear in your communication around the information you sought. I hope I've been able to clear things up for you though.
